poem:
Title: In The Shadow Of Word-Smiths

Shadows whisper on the newsprint, in these forested words,
Frost's footprints, dressed in ink, echo through my mind.
Oh, lovely, dark, the depth of a world unkind,
Mirrored in the glowing eyes of thriller birds. 

Miles to write before the dawn, promises to keep,
In every word, a promise, creeps silently, then leaps.
